definition: (neologism c. 2018) to incorporate ideas or material from sb else's creative work in one's own work
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
branch/stem/stalk/CL:根[gen1]/to block/to hinder/(Tw) interesting, fresh, or amusing subject matter or scenario
to plagiarize/to copy/to attack the flank or rear of an enemy
the attitude of mechanically borrowing (ideas etc)
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
circular argument/logical error consisting of begging the question/Latin: petitio principii
lit. new wine in old bottles; fig. new concepts in an old framework/(loan idiom from Matthew 9:17, but fig. meaning is opposite)
to bend the rules/to skirt around the issue
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
